required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exubera vs Lispro in a Lantus-based Regimen for Improved Glycemic Control in Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3b, Randomized, Open-Label, Parallel Group, Multicenter Trial Assessing The Efficacy Of Exubera Vs. Lispro Introduced Into A Lantus Based Regimen In Suboptimally Controlled Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The current trial will examine the efficacy and safety of Exubera administered as a mealtime insulin compared to lispro, when added to an existing regimen of basal insulin glargine + or = Oral Agents (OAs). Dose titrations will be provided which should allow a large proportion of subjects to reach target glycosylated hemoglobin (A1C) levels.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c %) at Week 24. Change = mean value at Week 24 minus mean value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mean glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c %) from Baseline to each visit through Week 24. Change = mean value at observation minus mean value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects That Attained Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) < 7.0%, < 6.5% and < 6.0% at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects acheiving glycemic control: HbA1c target levels of <7.0%, <6.5%, and <6.0% at Week 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects That Attained Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Target Levels of <7%, < 6.5%, and < 6.0% Without an Episode of Severe Hypoglycemia at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects that attained HbA1c target levels of <7%, < 6.5%,and <6.0% at Week 24 without an episode of severe hypoglycemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting and 2-hour Postprandial Glucose as Determined by 8-point Self-monitored Blood Glucose Profiles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from Baseline in fasting and 2-hour postprandial glucose at each visit in 8-point self-monitored blood glucose (SMBG) profiles: includes values prior to each meal (breakfast, lunch and dinner), 2 hours after each meal, at bedtime, and at 2:00 ante meridiem (a.m.) Change=observation value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting and Postprandial Plasma Glucose as Determined by Standardized Meal Tolerance Tests at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseine in fasting and postprandial plasma glucose as determined by standardized meal tolerance tests (MTT). Change = mean value at Week 12 minus mean value at Baseline. Time 0 results are for MTT (time 0) and non MTT (implied time 0) subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting and Postprandial Plasma Glucose as Determined by Standardized Meal Tolerance Tests at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in fasting and postprandial plasma glucose as determined by standardized meal tolerance tests (MTT). Change = mean value at Week 24 minus mean value at Baseline. Time 0 results are for MTT (time 0) and non MTT (implied time 0) subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting and Postprandial Lipids as Determined by Standard Meal Tolerance Tests
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in fasting and postprandial lipids at Week 12 and Week 24 as determined by standard meal tolerance tests. Change = value at observation minus value at Baseline. Postprandial = 120 mins after meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Change From Baseline in Fasting and Postprandial Markers of Cardiovascular (CV) Risk as Determined by Standardized Meal Tolerance Tests
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular risk markers included serum high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP)[mg/L], leptin (ng/mL), adiponectin (ug/mL), and spot urine microalbumin. Change = observation of mean fasting and postprandial markers of cardiovascular risk at Week 12 and Week 24 minus mean Baseline observation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Weight at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Change = mean body weight at observation minus mean body weight at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Lipids
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasting plasma lipids at Week 12 and Week 24. Change = observation mean minus Baseline mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Insulin Glargine Dose at Each Visit (Office and/or Phone)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in insulin glargine at each visit. Change = mean at observation minus mean Baseline observation. Basal dose = injection of basal insulin (IU) (insulin glargine).

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Prandial Insulin Dose (at Each Meal) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Dose of inhaled insulin prior to each meal at each visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Hypoglycemic Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Severe event = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable/irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild-moderate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Total Hypoglycemic Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Total number and severity of hypoglycemic events. Severe events = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable or irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild or moderate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Exposure for Hypoglycemic Subjects at Each Interval of the Study: Number of Subject Months of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subject months of treatment = number of days from start of treatment to last day of active treatment + 1 day lag (total number of subjects treated * days treated), including off-drug time)/30.44. Severity: severe = subject unable to treat self, had at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable/irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams/deciliter; or not measured but clinical manifestations were reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild or moderate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Crude Hypoglycemic Event Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Crude event rate = (number of events)/(subject months); severe hypoglycemic events: crude event rate = (number of events)/(100 subject months). Severe = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable or irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or unmeasured but clinical manifestestation reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = mild-moderate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient Treatment Satisfaction (as Assessed by Patient Satisfaction With Insulin Treatment [PSIT] Questionnaire)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction with insulin treatment Questionnaire (PSIT): 15-item self administered questionnaire that measures global satisfaction and two domains (subscales): convenience/ease of use and social comfort in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). The scoring of responses to each item is analyzed so that a higher item score indicates more satisfaction. Change = mean Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) score at observation minus mean score at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient Treatment Satisfaction (as Assessed by Patient Satisfaction With Insulin Treatment [PSIT] Questionnaire) From Week 4 to Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction with insulin treatment Questionnaire (PSIT): 15-item self administered questionnaire that measures global satisfaction and two domains (subscales): convenience/ease of use and social comfort in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). The scoring of responses to each item is analyzed so that a higher item score indicates more satisfaction. Change = difference in mean Patient Satisfaction with Insulin Treatment (PSIT) score from Week 4 to Week 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Mean Glucose Values Measured by Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean of 24-hour Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGMS) glucose values. Change from Baseline = mean at observation minus mean Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Standard Deviation of 24-hour Glucose Values Measured by Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in standard deviation of all blood glucose values within 24-hour period. Change = mean at observation minus mean at Baseline.

arm_group.description: Weight based initiation dose, and individually adjusted doses, per subject's blood glucose, over the six months study, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.
Weight based initiation dose, and individually adjusted doses, per subject's blood glucose, over the six months study, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

intervention.description: Weight based initiation dose, and individually adjusted doses, per subject's blood glucose, over the six months study, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.
Weight based initiation dose, and individually adjusted doses, per subject's blood glucose, over the six months study, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with type 2 diabetes using Lantus® (insulin glargine) as their basal insulin, not at glycemic goal.
Exclusion Criteria:
- lung disease
- current smoking or discontinued smoking within past 6 months

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 62 centers between June 2006 and August 2008.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: randomized but did not receive treatment

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at End of Treatment
outcome.description: Change from Baseline in glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c %) at Week 24. Change = mean value at Week 24 minus mean value at Baseline.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): subjects who received at least one dose of study medication, had a baseline glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c%) measurement, and had a post-baseline HbA1C measurement; last (post-baseline) observation carried forward (LOCF). Number of subjects with HbA1c values at Baseline and Week 24: Exubera® n=81, Lispro n=90.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at End of Treatment
measure.description: Change from Baseline in glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c %) at Week 24. Change = mean value at Week 24 minus mean value at Baseline.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): subjects who received at least one dose of study medication, had a baseline glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c%) measurement, and had a post-baseline HbA1C measurement; last (post-baseline) observation carried forward (LOCF). Number of subjects with HbA1c values at Baseline and Week 24: Exubera® n=81, Lispro n=90.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Each Visit
outcome.description: Change in mean glycosylated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c %) from Baseline to each visit through Week 24. Change = mean value at observation minus mean value at Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
outcome.population: FAS; LOCF; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

measure.population: FAS; LOCF; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

measure.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Change From Baseline in Fasting and Postprandial Markers of Cardiovascular (CV) Risk as Determined by Standardized Meal Tolerance Tests
outcome.description: Cardiovascular risk markers included serum high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP)[mg/L], leptin (ng/mL), adiponectin (ug/mL), and spot urine microalbumin. Change = observation of mean fasting and postprandial markers of cardiovascular risk at Week 12 and Week 24 minus mean Baseline observation.
outcome.population: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program, too few patients participated to explore the markers of cardiovascular (CV) risks so these markers were not summarized.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

Change = observation of mean fasting and postprandial markers of cardiovascular risk at Week 12 and Week 24 minus mean Baseline observation.
measure.population: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program, too few patients participated to explore the markers of cardiovascular (CV) risks so these markers were not summarized.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline Weight at Each Visit
outcome.description: Change = mean body weight at observation minus mean body weight at Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
outcome.population: FAS; LOCF (all visits except Baseline); N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline Weight at Each Visit
measure.description: Change = mean body weight at observation minus mean body weight at Baseline.
measure.population: FAS; LOCF (all visits except Baseline); N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Lipids
outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasting plasma lipids at Week 12 and Week 24. Change = observation mean minus Baseline mean.
outcome.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Lipids
measure.description: Change from baseline in fasting plasma lipids at Week 12 and Week 24. Change = observation mean minus Baseline mean.
measure.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Insulin Glargine Dose at Each Visit (Office and/or Phone)
outcome.description: Change from Baseline in insulin glargine at each visit. Change = mean at observation minus mean Baseline observation. Basal dose = injection of basal insulin (IU) (insulin glargine).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; Lispro international units (IU) were converted to milligrams (mg) equivalent; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Insulin Glargine Dose at Each Visit (Office and/or Phone)
measure.description: Change from Baseline in insulin glargine at each visit. Change = mean at observation minus mean Baseline observation. Basal dose = injection of basal insulin (IU) (insulin glargine).
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; Lispro international units (IU) were converted to milligrams (mg) equivalent; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Baseline Prandial Insulin Dose (at Each Meal) at Each Visit
outcome.description: Dose of inhaled insulin prior to each meal at each visit.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose, and individually adjusted doses, per subject's blood glucose, over the six months study, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

measure.title: Baseline Prandial Insulin Dose (at Each Meal) at Each Visit
measure.description: Dose of inhaled insulin prior to each meal at each visit.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Hypoglycemic Events
outcome.description: Severe event = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable/irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild-moderate.
outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Hypoglycemic Events
measure.description: Severe event = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable/irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild-moderate.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Number of Total Hypoglycemic Events
outcome.description: Total number and severity of hypoglycemic events. Severe events = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable or irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild or moderate.
outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Number of Total Hypoglycemic Events
measure.description: Total number and severity of hypoglycemic events. Severe events = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable or irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild or moderate.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Treatment Exposure for Hypoglycemic Subjects at Each Interval of the Study: Number of Subject Months of Treatment
outcome.description: Subject months of treatment = number of days from start of treatment to last day of active treatment + 1 day lag (total number of subjects treated * days treated), including off-drug time)/30.44. Severity: severe = subject unable to treat self, had at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable/irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams/deciliter; or not measured but clinical manifestations were reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild or moderate.
outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Treatment Exposure for Hypoglycemic Subjects at Each Interval of the Study: Number of Subject Months of Treatment
measure.description: Subject months of treatment = number of days from start of treatment to last day of active treatment + 1 day lag (total number of subjects treated * days treated), including off-drug time)/30.44. Severity: severe = subject unable to treat self, had at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable/irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams/deciliter; or not measured but clinical manifestations were reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = events that were mild or moderate.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least one dose of study medication; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Crude Hypoglycemic Event Rate
outcome.description: Crude event rate = (number of events)/(subject months); severe hypoglycemic events: crude event rate = (number of events)/(100 subject months). Severe = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable or irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or unmeasured but clinical manifestestation reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = mild-moderate.
outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 4, Month 5, Month 6
outcome.population: Safety population; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Crude Hypoglycemic Event Rate
measure.description: Crude event rate = (number of events)/(subject months); severe hypoglycemic events: crude event rate = (number of events)/(100 subject months). Severe = subject unable to treat self, at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable or irrational behavior, difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness), and blood glucose <= 49 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) or unmeasured but clinical manifestestation reversed by oral carbohydrates or glucose. Non-severe events = mild-moderate.
measure.population: Safety population; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Treatment Satisfaction (as Assessed by Patient Satisfaction With Insulin Treatment [PSIT] Questionnaire)
outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction with insulin treatment Questionnaire (PSIT): 15-item self administered questionnaire that measures global satisfaction and two domains (subscales): convenience/ease of use and social comfort in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). The scoring of responses to each item is analyzed so that a higher item score indicates more satisfaction. Change = mean Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) score at observation minus mean score at Baseline.
outcome.population: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program descriptive statistics for the Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) Questionnaire were not provided.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Treatment Satisfaction (as Assessed by Patient Satisfaction With Insulin Treatment [PSIT] Questionnaire)
measure.description: Patient Satisfaction with insulin treatment Questionnaire (PSIT): 15-item self administered questionnaire that measures global satisfaction and two domains (subscales): convenience/ease of use and social comfort in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). The scoring of responses to each item is analyzed so that a higher item score indicates more satisfaction. Change = mean Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) score at observation minus mean score at Baseline.
measure.population: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program descriptive statistics for the Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) Questionnaire were not provided.

outcome.title: Change in Patient Treatment Satisfaction (as Assessed by Patient Satisfaction With Insulin Treatment [PSIT] Questionnaire) From Week 4 to Week 24
outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction with insulin treatment Questionnaire (PSIT): 15-item self administered questionnaire that measures global satisfaction and two domains (subscales): convenience/ease of use and social comfort in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). The scoring of responses to each item is analyzed so that a higher item score indicates more satisfaction. Change = difference in mean Patient Satisfaction with Insulin Treatment (PSIT) score from Week 4 to Week 24.
outcome.population: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program descriptive statistics for the Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) Questionnaire were not provided.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change in Patient Treatment Satisfaction (as Assessed by Patient Satisfaction With Insulin Treatment [PSIT] Questionnaire) From Week 4 to Week 24
measure.description: Patient Satisfaction with insulin treatment Questionnaire (PSIT): 15-item self administered questionnaire that measures global satisfaction and two domains (subscales): convenience/ease of use and social comfort in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). The scoring of responses to each item is analyzed so that a higher item score indicates more satisfaction. Change = difference in mean Patient Satisfaction with Insulin Treatment (PSIT) score from Week 4 to Week 24.
measure.population: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program descriptive statistics for the Patient Satisfaction of Insulin Treatment (PSIT) Questionnaire were not provided.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Mean Glucose Values Measured by Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
outcome.description: Mean of 24-hour Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGMS) glucose values. Change from Baseline = mean at observation minus mean Baseline value.
outcome.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Mean Glucose Values Measured by Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
measure.description: Mean of 24-hour Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGMS) glucose values. Change from Baseline = mean at observation minus mean Baseline value.
measure.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Standard Deviation of 24-hour Glucose Values Measured by Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
outcome.description: Mean change in standard deviation of all blood glucose values within 24-hour period. Change = mean at observation minus mean at Baseline.
outcome.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Standard Deviation of 24-hour Glucose Values Measured by Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
measure.description: Mean change in standard deviation of all blood glucose values within 24-hour period. Change = mean at observation minus mean at Baseline.
measure.population: FAS; N=number of subjects with evaluable data; n=number of subjects with evaluable data at observation: Exubera, Lispro, respectively.

reported_events.desc: Number of participants at risk for serious and other adverse events was determined by the number of participants who took at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Exubera®
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of Exubera® (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); approx. 0.05 mg/kg per meal, three times per day [TID]), and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Weight based initiation dose of insulin-lispro (total daily dose: body weight in kilograms (kg) x 0.15 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg); divided into 3 equal preprandial doses [before breakfast, lunch, and dinner], and individually titrated doses per subject's blood glucose, in addition to insulin glargine and oral agents. The approximate insulin-lispro dose in units was prescribed based on the calculated dose of Exubera® (conversion from milligrams (mg) of Exubera® to international units (IU) of insulin-lispro was approx. 3:1).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to cancellation of the EXUBERA program the sample size was too small to adequately address the inferential objectives of this study. Descriptive statistics for the PSIT Questionnaire and the markers of cardiovascular risk were not provided.
